page.title: 02WELSHPOOL-A TRADING CENTRE
page.content: A charter granted in 1263 first gave Welshpol the right to hold a weekly market on a Monday, and in 1863 the {Smithfield livestock market}was established. The market is held every Monday and animals sold here include heifers, bullocks, dairy cows, calves,fat pigs and all types of sheep. The annual throughput of sheep is the largest in the Common Market and the market can hold 15-16,000 sheep and 700 cattle on one day. Welshpool also possesses a{street} {market}held on a Monday and Saturday. On Mondays the market is usually outdoors selling clothes, jewellery, food and bedding. The main street, Broad Street, has {shops}ranging from individual grocers, ironmongers, clothes shops, tourist gift shops and chemists to chain stores like Woolworths and Boots.
